ORDER

The facts in a nut shell for consideration of this case is as
follows :

The petitioner is the accused in C.C.No.68/2013 on the files of
the Judicial First Class Magistrate, Wadakkanchery. The offences
alleged are under Sections 379 of IPC and Sections 135, 138, 150 of
Kerala Electricity Act and Section 136(e) of Electricity Amendment
Act, 2007. The allegation is that by tapping electricity from consumer
connection No.271 of Chelakara section, which is a domestic
connection, petitioner committed theft of electricity for industrial
purpose and thereby the Board sustained a loss of Rs.19,376/-. A
complaint was filed by the Assistant Engineer before the Police on
which crime No.624/2012 was registered by the Police. It is the case of
the petitioner that thereafter the bill for the above referred amount was
cancelled by the Deputy Chief Engineer in an appellate proceeding and
further the case is that when the allegation of loss of Rs.19.376/- goes,
a complaint will not lie.

2017/KER/1800
Crl.M.C.No.5121/2013 2

2. I heard the learned Public Prosecutor. The learned Public
Prosecutor submitted before me that it is the Electricity Board which
has to decide the fate of the case. On a perusal of the proceeding of
this court, it is seen that Assistant Engineer of the KSEB, Chelakara
section is also seen impleaded as additional respondent No.2 by order
dated 14/02/2014. Additional respondent No.2 is represented by
Adv.Sri.P.Ahammed.

3. The learned counsel appearing for the KSEB submitted that
there is no objection in quashing the case as the appellate authority has
already quashed the bill demanding the above referred amount.

Thus, recording the submission that there is no objection by the
defacto complainant in quashing all the proceeding in C.C.No.68/2013,
all the proceedings in C.C.No.68/2013 on the files of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate, Wadakkanchery is hereby quashed.

K.P.JYOTHINDRANATH
JUDGE
SV.
